1_16W7DGWDAvsBcc33SGvY63MCT9uZykYve4.body:
> [jlxip](#comment_19_195Xafx3aZsxtngKo7D3XWgByQ5rYJX1C): Actually, there is a simple solution to the IP leak problem.This is setting in the browser settings a non-working proxy (for example, localhost:8080) to all directions except 127.0.0.1 (and/or localhost).In firefox it's pretty easy. And you can check if it works with this page I made: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1K3cpBdySkLF4qUcfJyN5d5xGDgXgB1wpm/

Site can still get your IP address via WebRTC. See [this internet site](https://browserleaks.com/webrtc#webrtc-disable) for details.
